perturbation.original_text: Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.changed_text: Fees: The total project cost shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Customer shall remit payment to the Vendor as follows: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 25% ($69,750.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 15% ($41,850.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Client' and 'Customer' are used interchangeably, creating confusion. 'Developer' is also switched to 'Vendor', also creating confusion of the entities. Additionally, the percentages for Milestone #2 and Milestone #3 were altered, causing a mismatch with the total project cost, which should add up to $279,000.00 but doesn't.

perturbation.original_text: This estimate may change depending on unforeseen circumstances or requirements. We estimate that the website (Customer Portal) will take 3 months to complete because this will be the priority.
perturbation.changed_text: This estimate is fixed and will not change regardless of circumstances. We estimate that the website (Consumer Portal) will take 6 months to complete; this will be the priority.
perturbation.explanation: The 'Customer Portal' has been switched to the 'Consumer Portal' without proper definition creating risk and confusion. The original text allows for a change in the estimate of the project length under unforeseen circumstances, but that has been modified, creating contradictions. The estimated project length has also been doubled, leading to further contradictions.

perturbation.original_text: Admin Portal · Verifications o Admins will manually verify new dispensaries that sign-up by reviewing their uploaded documents § Once verified they can select "Approved" and that will grant the dispensary access to the portal · If accepted, it will send an automated email to the dispensary notifying them § Admins can decline the application.
perturbation.changed_text: Admin Portal · Authorizations o Managers will automatically verify new dispensaries that register by reviewing their submitted documentation § Once verified, they can select "Confirmed", which grants the dispensary access to the hub. · If authorized, a manual notification to the dispensary will be sent § Managers can reject the application.
perturbation.explanation: Several changes introduce confusion here. 'Admins' are now 'Managers', 'sign-up' becomes 'register', 'uploaded documents' becomes 'submitted documentation', 'portal' becomes 'hub', 'Approved' becomes 'Confirmed', 'automated email' becomes 'manual notification', and 'decline' becomes 'reject'. These undefined changes create ambiguity and potential disputes.
